verses.roman:
pradrutya dūraṁ saṁśrāntau
tuṅgam āruhatāṁ girim
pravarṣaṇākhyaṁ bhagavān
nityadā yatra varṣati

synonyms: pradrutya—having run with full speed; dūram—a long distance; saṁśrāntau—exhausted; tuṅgam—very high; āruhatām—They climbed; girim—the mountain; pravarṣaṇa-ākhyam—known as Pravarṣaṇa; bhagavān—Lord Indra; nityadā—always; yatra—where; varṣati—he rains.
translation: Apparently exhausted after fleeing a long distance, the two Lords climbed a high mountain named Pravarṣaṇa, upon which Lord Indra showers incessant rain.
